entry.title: Paul Davis, the creator of Ardour (unfa live interview 2022-10-02)

media:group.media:title: Paul Davis, the creator of Ardour (unfa live interview 2022-10-02)
media:group.media:description:
--- LINKS:
- Ardour 7 pre-release changelog (will go down in the future): https://ardour.org/whatsnew7.html
- Ardour's latest release changelog (as of writing poins to Ardour 6.9 release): https://ardour.org/whatsnew
- This interview on PeerTube (thanks to falkTX fro hosting!): https://peertube.kx.studio/w/7us4th2nWfirURq7C9wvYh
--- TIMESTAMPS (contributed by Olli - thank you!):
00:00 Warmup 30:10 Introduction 38:00 Opensource and Funding ... is the Ardour model effective? 41:50 Who long does it take to code Ardour till it was in a working state? 45:00 Why Ardour? (in comparesant to StudioOne) (general talk about DAWs) 49:05 Workflows in DAWs 51:30 Ardour7 development history compared to Ardour6 58:10 Motivation to commit to an opensource model 1:03:00 Pauls favourite Linux distro 1:03:40 Tips for beginning audio programming 1:08:00 About Zrythm 1:09:10 Opensource programmers like to reinvent things 1:10:25 Why Paul wrote Ardour in the first place 1:12:50 What engine components of Ardour are written in Assembly? 1:15:10 What midi workflow changes would you like to implement in the future? (concerns also dedicated midi editing window requests as well as velocity lollipops and Ardour7 tweaks) 1:24:35 Mix template for Ardour that is like Mixbus32 1:25:55 LV2 and the inline displays in Ardour 1:28:15 Do all popular DAWs including Ardour provide the same audio quality on recording and playback? 1:32:10 What is Paul's opinion about Pipewire? 1:38:10 Do Paul has any issues with Pipewire lately ? 1:42:05 About a media manager in Ardour 1:49:40 Are there any new stock plugins in Ardour7? 1:50:00 About Elastic Audio and timing corrections and Paul's opinion about the possibilities in modern DAWs for correcting bad play and music making/recording as an social activity and the impact of modern technology 2:07:00 Pauls answers whether he considered to work for a commercial DAW company? 2:12:00 More about the collaboration with Harrison 2:19:00 Ardour7 changelog walkthrough 2:19:30 Clip launching in Ardour7 - test 2:31:45 Clip launching in Ardour7 - options at the bottom of the cue view 2:41:50 Content Downloader in Ardour7 2:47:30 Cue Markers in Ardour7 2:55:30 Bounce parts into a trigger slot or to the clip library 3:03:10 Internal time representation in Ardour7 3:04:50 Ripple modes/editing in Ardour7 3:15:30 curved automation in Ardour ... is it possible yet? 3:16:20 Mixer scenes in Ardour7 3:20:45 about MIDI editing in Ardour7 3:23:20 MIDI stem export in Ardour7 3:24:15 Freesound import in Ardour7 3:26:55 I/O Plugins in Ardour7 (Control Surfaces of Ardour7) 3:30:30 Final words and thanks to Paul
--- SUPPORT MY WORK:
https://patreon.com/unfa https://liberapay.com/unfa https://paypal.me/unfa
--- CHECK OUT MY MUSIC:
https://audius.co/unfa https://unfa.bandcamp.com https://soundcloud.com/unfa
--- FIND MY VIDEOS:
- PeerTube (open-source, decentralized): https://peertube.kx.studio/c/unfastudio/
- Odysee (user-side is open-source, centralized): https://odysee.com/@unfa
- YouTube (fully proprietary, centralized): https://www.youtube.com/unfa000
--- GET IN TOUCH:
https://mastodon.social/@unfa https://chat.unfa.xyz https://discord.gg/tgZSvht https://facebook.com/unfamusic (absolute last resort)
--- LIVESTREAMS:
- Next event: https://www.youtube.com/unfa000/live
- Past events: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLi2LbJnGR-482eAAihWd6exqyp0bQMfPX
- Submit music: https://forms.gle/pLDetJM2WZf8eTRt5
--- ORDER OR PRINT YOUR OWN MERCH:
https://teespring.com/stores/unfa https://github.com/unfa/merch
--- OTHER INFO:
This video was produced exclusively with open-source software and GNU/Linux.
- Studio software: https://archlinux.org (operating system) https://www.kde.org/plasma-desktop (desktop environment) https://www.olivevideoeditor.org/ (v. 0.1.2; video editing) https://obsproject.com/ (video capture / streaming) https://www.maartenbaert.be/simplescreenrecorder/ (additional screen capture) https://www.blender.org/ (3d art and animation) https://inkscape.org/ (2d vector art and thumbnail images) https://gimp.org/ (photo manipulation) https://kx.studio/Applications:Carla (live audio processing) Audacity [pre MuseGroup version] (final audio touchup and level control)
- Studio hardware: CPU: AMD Ryzen 9 3900X GPU: AMD Radeon 6800XT 16 GB Mobo: Gigabyte B550 AORUS ELITE V2 Audio I/F: PreSonus Studio24C Mics: Behringer B-1 (condenser); Shure SM57 (dynamic) + A2WS; Boya BY-M1 (lavalier) Main cam: Panasonic Lumix GH5 Top cam: Logitech C920 Aux cam: OnePlus 5T
MIDI controller: M-Audio Oxygen 49 MKIV Coffee machine: DeLonghi ECP33.21 Mug: https://is.gd/unfamug

entry.title: Was I wrong about Virtual Playing Orchestra?

media:group.media:title: Was I wrong about Virtual Playing Orchestra?
media:group.media:description:
--- LINKS:
- Nils' list of unambiguously licensed sampled instruments that for sure don't require attribution or specific licensing: https://hilbricht.net/articles/
- Carl Irwin's initial video replying to my "Don't use VPO" video: https://youtu.be/vt2fQvmE2ys
- Carl's 2nd, more consice video on the subject: https://youtu.be/3OdO2iBbJcg
- Carl's public document on the subject: https://drive.google.com/file/d/15onBm00KGEYwDmXVlaTCccBUkmptlJVa/view
- My initial "Don't use VPO" video (now unlisted). https://youtu.be/y9ZLgDqIIbQ Please DO NOT send people the above link - send them a link this THIS video instead for full context. Thank you.
--- TIMESTAMPS (contributed by 0GL):
0:00 Intro & Apology 0:47 Unfa's original argument 2:27 Summary of Carl Irwin's counterargument 3:58 What happened to the original video? 4:54 The problem is very fuzzy (do licenses transform or not?) 6:40 Conclusion & Recommendations 8:03 Outro & Announcements
--- SPECIAL THANKS
To LogosCoder for his editing work on this video! To MattKC for fixing issues with Olive 0.2 just-in-time and making this amazing libre video editor!

entry.title: An introduction to open-source music production software (live with HKU.nl)

media:group.media:title: An introduction to open-source music production software (live with HKU.nl)
media:group.media:description:
--- LINKS:
- My videos that will teach you Ardour: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLi2LbJnGR-49PM2Pbs46zySEO-7tBsBsI
- Huge thanks to Marc and HKU for invitating me to give this presentation to their students! And thanks to everyone who attended the session! https://www.hku.nl/

entry.title: EVERY vocal track NEEDS THIS plug-in! (Airwindows DeBess) [possibly disturbing imagery]

media:group.media:title: EVERY vocal track NEEDS THIS plug-in! (Airwindows DeBess) [possibly disturbing imagery]
media:group.media:description:
Airwindows DeBess open-source de-esser audio plug-in is mandatory for vocals. Fight me!

entry.title: unfatarians on the SVS IV Festival 2022-05-07

media:group.media:title: unfatarians on the SVS IV Festival 2022-05-07
media:group.media:description:
This is an archive of a SvS (Server vs Server) IV (4th edition) Festival day 2 livestream where my community's EP was played and we were guests on the stream to talk about the process and explain what are we all about :)
Enormous thanks to Story (the SvS's founder) who's invited us to take part in this charity event and to JohnTheBard who's been a driving force behind the entire unfatarians collaboration. Also huge thanks to everyone who's contributed and created this EP and for the entire SvS staff for making this possible!
--- TIMESTAMPS:
00:00 - Playing the EP: unfatarians - Secrets 15:53 - Interview with JohnTheBard and unfa
--- LINKS:
- Check out SvS: https://www.servervsserver.com/
- Download the "Secrets" EP by unfatarians https://unfa.bandcamp.com/album/secrets
